availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Maysville, Kentucky, clerk. Maysville native. Son of George Cox and Ann Hopkinson Cox. Clerk in Maysville in 1850. Household owned one enslaved person in 1850. Employed as a clerk by his father, George Cox, in Maysville in 1860. Clerk in Maysville in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, p. 32A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, p. 1.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, p. 325.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, Ward 2, p. 420A.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Kentucky, 9th Congressional District, Vol. 1, September 1863, p. 62, p. 65 of microfilm, (Accessed via ancestry.com on May 22, 2020).
Find A Grave, "Lissant Cox (1826-1905)," Memorial #23699906, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/23699906# (accessed December 16, 2018).
